2.speaker: PENGUIN
2.japanese: {\an8}僕　なんか今日は人から褒めてほしい気分なんだよね
2.english: I'm in the mood today to be praised by others.

4.speaker: SASAKO
4.japanese: {\an8}じゃあ　パッと褒めますね
4.english: Then I will quickly praise you.

6.speaker: PENGUIN
6.japanese: もう少しゆっくりと　優しく僕と向き合う時間って…
6.english: don't you have a little more time to kindly talk with me... You know, never mind. Please go back to work.

7.speaker: PANDA
7.japanese: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん

9.speaker: PANDA
9.japanese: ごめんね　ペンギンさんのこと　褒める気にならなくて
9.english: Sorry. I don't feel like praising you. You're going to give up right from the start.

10.speaker: PENGUIN
10.japanese: 大丈夫　あとで　お母さんに電話してみるよ
10.english: That's okay. I'll call my mom later.

11.speaker: POLAR BEAR
11.japanese: 笹子さん　今日はブロッコリーとキノコがいいのとれたから
11.english: Miss Sasako, I got some good broccoli and mushrooms from the garden,

12.speaker: POLAR BEAR
12.japanese: 日替わりのランチはパスタにしよう
12.english: so let's make today's lunch special pasta.

14.speaker: SASAKO
14.japanese: わぁ！　新鮮でおいしそうですね
14.english: Wow, they look so fresh and delicious.

15.speaker: PENGUIN
15.japanese: ねぇ　シロクマくん　前から気になってたんだけどさ
15.english: Hey, Polar Bear, I've always wondered...

16.speaker: POLAR BEAR
16.japanese: え？　ペンギンさんの将来設計？
16.english: What? Your future plans? I wonder about that, too, but that's not it.

18.speaker: PENGUIN
18.japanese: 野菜って　いつも庭からとってきてるの？
18.english: Do you always get vegetables from the vegetable garden out there?

19.speaker: POLAR BEAR
19.japanese: そうだよ　庭の菜園　言ってなかった？
19.english: Yep. From the Café's vegetable garden. Didn't I tell you?

20.speaker: PENGUIN
20.japanese: うん　聞いてないよ
20.english: Nope. First time I heard about it.

21.speaker: POLAR BEAR
21.japanese: ペンギンさんには言ってないからね
21.english: Well that's because I didn't tell you, Mr. Penguin. I wonder if I'm the only one you didn't tell.

23.speaker: PENGUIN
23.japanese: ところで　カフェの庭って　どうなってるの？
23.english: By the way, what does the Café's yard look like?

24.speaker: PENGUIN
24.japanese: ずいぶん広いみたいだけど

25.speaker: PANDA
25.japanese: 僕　隣に住んでるけど　よく知らないよ
25.english: I live right next door, but I have no idea.

26.speaker: SASAKO
26.japanese: そういえば私も　全部は知らないんですよね
26.english: Come to think of it, there are things I don't know about it, either.

27.speaker: POLAR BEAR
27.english: Do you want to go see?

34.speaker: SASAKO
34.japanese: あっ　はい　私も行きたいなって
34.english: Oh, yes. I'd like to go, too.

35.speaker: POLAR BEAR
35.japanese: けど　お店に誰もいなくなっちゃうよ
35.english: But then there'd be no one to watch the café.

38.speaker: POLAR BEAR
38.japanese: まず　ここが　オープンテラス
38.english: First, we have the open terrace.

39.speaker: PENGUIN
39.japanese: ここは　とばそう　知ってるから
39.english: Let's skip this. We know this part.

42.speaker: PANDA
42.english: That's my house over there. Huh? Maybe it's over here?

43.speaker: PANDA
43.japanese: ねぇ　ペンギンさん知ってる？
43.english: Hey, do you know where it is?

44.speaker: PENGUIN
44.japanese: キミは黙っててもいいよ

45.speaker: POLAR BEAR
45.english: I guess it doesn't hurt to ask. Mr. Llama is such a nice guy. Welcome.

46.speaker: POLAR BEAR
46.japanese: そこが　キノボリカンガルーさんの　コーヒー豆の焙煎所
46.english: That's Mr. Tree Kangaroo's Coffee Roasting Plant.

47.speaker: MASAKI
47.japanese: あっ　シロクマさん　こんにちは！お疲れっす！
47.english: Oh hi, Mr. Polar Bear. Thanks for your hard work.

48.speaker: POLAR BEAR
48.japanese: ここは　知ってるから　とばすよ
48.english: We already know this place, so we're skipping it.

49.speaker: MASAKI
49.japanese: えっ　もう行っちゃうんすか？

50.speaker: PANDA
50.japanese: もう少し　ゆったり見ようよ
50.english: Let's take our time looking around.

51.speaker: POLAR BEAR
51.japanese: ゆったり見てたら　一日じゃ終わらないかもしれないよ
51.english: But if we take too long, we might not be able to see everything in one day.

52.speaker: PENGUIN
52.japanese: そんなに広かったんだ　この庭
52.english: I had no idea this yard was so big.

53.speaker: POLAR BEAR
53.english: Well, we'll see. Guess you'll just have to see for yourself.

55.speaker: PANDA
55.english: What kind of tree is this?

57.speaker: POLAR BEAR
57.japanese: 春に　お花見した場所だよ
57.english: We did our cherry blossom viewing here last spring.

59.speaker: SASAKO
59.japanese: 初めて　桜の紅葉って　じっくり見ましたけど
59.english: This is the first time I've seen a cherry blossom tree in the fall,

60.speaker: SASAKO
60.japanese: この時期もいいですね
60.english: but it's quite nice this time of the year, too.

61.speaker: PENGUIN
61.japanese: 僕は　あんまり覚えてないんだよなぁ
61.english: I don't remember that day much. That's because you always drink so much, Mr. Penguin.

62.speaker: PENGUIN
62.japanese: 名倉さんに　そっくり！
62.english: You look just like Mr. Nagura!

64.speaker: POLAR BEAR
64.japanese: それは　クリタケ　食べられるよ
64.english: Those are Brick Cap mushrooms. They're edible. Ow!

65.speaker: POLAR BEAR
65.japanese: クリが落ちてるかもしれないから
65.english: Oh, there might be some chestnuts on the ground. Say something sooner!

66.speaker: SASAKO
66.japanese: アケビがなってるの　初めて見ました
66.english: This is the first time I've seen an Akebia tree bear fruit.

67.speaker: POLAR BEAR
67.japanese: 実がはぜてるのが　食べごろだよ
67.english: You eat them when they look ready to burst.

68.speaker: SASAKO
68.japanese: ちょっと歩いただけで　いろいろあるんですね
68.english: There's so much, even though we haven't walked that far.

71.speaker: PANDA
71.japanese: ナマケモノくんって　家があったんだね
71.english: I guess Sloth did have a house.

72.speaker: POLAR BEAR
72.japanese: けど　なかなか家に帰れてないんじゃないかな
72.english: But it doesn't look like he's home much. Why does he even get the paper?

73.speaker: PANDA
73.english: I wonder if he's out right now.

74.speaker: POLAR BEAR
74.japanese: あっちに行くと　菜園があるんだ
74.english: Over there, is the vegetable garden.

76.speaker: PENGUIN
76.english: What's over there? You wanna know?

77.speaker: PENGUIN
77.japanese: なんか　嫌な予感がするから　やめとくよ
77.english: I have a bad feeling about this, so never mind.

79.speaker: PENGUIN
79.japanese: いいから次行こう　次！
79.english: Never mind! Let's go to the next place!

80.speaker: PENGUIN
80.japanese: ここにあったんだね　菜園
80.english: So this is where the vegetable garden is.

82.speaker: KANGAROO
82.japanese: どうしたんですか？　今日はみんなで
82.english: What brings you all out here today?

83.speaker: POLAR BEAR
83.japanese: ここは　カンガルーさんの菜園なんだ
83.english: This is the kangaroos' vegetable garden.

85.speaker: KANGAROO2
85.japanese: しろくまカフェの料理は新鮮なとりたて野菜で作る料理ですからね
85.english: The food served at Polar Bear's Café is made with fresh garden vegetables.

86.speaker: KANGAROO
86.japanese: だから　おいしいんですよ

87.speaker: KANGAROO3
87.japanese: 向こうには　果樹もありますよ
87.english: There's also an orchard right over there. Juice made from freshly picked fruit is the best.

89.speaker: PENGUIN
89.japanese: ちょっと止まれませんかね？
89.english: Could you stop for a bit?

92.speaker: KANGAROO
92.japanese: で　今日はどうしたんですか？
92.english: So, what brings you here today?

93.speaker: KANGAROO
93.japanese: 手伝ってくれるんですか？
93.english: Are you here to help us out?

94.speaker: PENGUIN
94.japanese: いや　今日はそういうわけじゃなくて　みんなで
94.english: Well, no. Today, all of us ar—

95.speaker: PENGUIN
95.japanese: あれ？またそういうパターン？
95.english: Huh? Are we really doing this again?

97.speaker: PENGUIN
97.japanese: なんで先に行っちゃうの？
97.english: Why'd you go on without me?

98.speaker: POLAR BEAR
98.japanese: ごめん　ごめん　足が動いちゃって
98.english: Sorry about that. Our legs moved on their own.

99.speaker: PENGUIN
99.japanese: 何そのクオリティー低い言い訳
99.english: The heck is up with that lame excuse?

100.speaker: PANDA
100.japanese: カンガルーさんのお手伝いはしないの？
100.english: You're not going to help the kangaroos out?

101.speaker: PENGUIN
101.japanese: あとで行くよ　ひとまわりしたらね
101.english: I'll help out later. After we've seen the whole yard.

102.speaker: POLAR BEAR
102.english: I'll go, too. And this is... Prairie Dog's herb garden. So you even grow all the herbs in the yard, too.

103.speaker: SASAKO
103.japanese: あっ　あそこは何ですか？

104.speaker: PENGUIN
104.japanese: 笹子さん　のってるね

106.speaker: POLAR BEAR
106.japanese: キツネザルさんの　モッツァレラチーズ工房だよ
106.english: The lemurs' mozzarella cheese workshop. Wow.

107.speaker: PENGUIN
107.japanese: チーズも自家製なんだ
107.english: So the cheese is homemade, too.

108.speaker: POLAR BEAR
108.english: Didn't I tell you? Nope. In general, you don't tell me anything.

109.speaker: PANDA
109.japanese: おさるさんが作ってたんだね

111.speaker: SASAKO
111.japanese: あれ？　あそこにいるのは…

113.speaker: LEMUR
113.japanese: うちのチーズは　普通のミルクじゃなくて
113.english: Our mozzarella cheese is authentic and is made

114.japanese: 水牛さんのミルクを使ってる　本物のモッツァレラチーズだからね
114.english: from water buffalo milk rather than regular milk.

115.speaker: LEMUR2
115.japanese: 水牛さんのとれたてミルクで作る　モッツァレラチーズは　最高なんだ
115.english: Mozzarella cheese made from fresh  water buffalo milk is the best.

116.speaker: PANDA
116.japanese: 何も手伝わないで　味見だけしたいな
116.english: I want to have a taste without helping out at all.

117.speaker: PENGUIN
117.japanese: キミって　すごく正直だよね

119.speaker: PANDA
119.english: Wow, it's so light and fluffy!

121.speaker: POLAR BEAR
121.japanese: あとで　これでピザ焼こう
121.english: Let's make pizza with this cheese later.

122.speaker: PANDA
122.japanese: じゃあ　すぐ帰ろう

123.speaker: PANDA
123.japanese: 何も手伝わないけど　ピザ早く食べようよ
123.english: I'm not going to help at all, but let's hurry and eat pizza.

124.speaker: PENGUIN
124.japanese: 正直なのは　わかったから　ひと回り見てからにしない？
124.english: We know you're brutally honest, but could you wait until we're done looking?

125.speaker: PENGUIN
125.japanese: 庭とは思えないね　ほんと広いな～
125.english: I can't believe this is your yard. It's huge.

126.speaker: PANDA
126.japanese: だから　早くピザ食べに戻ろうよ
126.english: Come on. Let's hurry and go back so we can eat pizza.

127.speaker: PENGUIN
127.japanese: キミ　ほんと正直だよね
127.english: You really don't hold back, do you?

128.speaker: PENGUIN
128.japanese: あれ？　こんな所にハンモック？
128.english: Huh? A hammock in a place like this?

129.speaker: POLAR BEAR
129.japanese: うん　僕が　昼寝したりするんだ
129.english: Yes. I take naps here sometimes.

130.speaker: PENGUIN
130.japanese: へぇ～　それは最高だね
130.english: Wow, that sounds great. Could you give me a lift, Polar Bear?

133.speaker: PENGUIN
133.japanese: 痛いね　最高の前に　最悪がきたよ
133.english: That hurt. Apparently I got to experience the worst before the best. This is great.

134.speaker: PANDA
134.japanese: ペンギンさん　そろそろ代わってよ
134.english: Mr. Penguin, let me try already.

135.speaker: PENGUIN
135.japanese: そろそろって　キミ…　僕　今　乗ったばかりなんだけど
135.english: What do you mean, "already"? I just got up here.

136.speaker: POLAR BEAR
136.japanese: まぁまぁ　そんなこと言わずに
136.english: Now, now. Don't be like that.

139.speaker: SASAKO
139.japanese: そういえば　ラマさん　大丈夫ですかね？
139.english: By the way... I wonder if Mr. Llama is doing all right.

140.speaker: POLAR BEAR
140.japanese: 大丈夫って言ってたから　大丈夫だよ
140.english: He said he'd be all right, so I'm sure he's all right. Thanks for waiting. Here's your caffè latte and cappuccino.

141.speaker: POLAR BEAR
141.japanese: それから　ここが　僕が　ゴルフの練習するとこ
141.english: And this is where I practice golfing.

142.speaker: PENGUIN
142.japanese: いいな～　今度　僕も来ていい？
142.english: Must be nice. Can I come next time? Of course. And then over there...

143.speaker: POLAR BEAR
143.japanese: グリズリーくんと　バスケット　やったりするんだ
143.english: I play basketball with Grizzly sometimes.

144.speaker: POLAR BEAR
144.japanese: この先は　アスレチックになってて
144.english: Up ahead is an obstacle course.

145.speaker: POLAR BEAR
145.japanese: あっちには　ちょっとした釣堀があるよ
145.english: And over there is a small fishing pond.

146.speaker: PENGUIN
146.japanese: シロクマくんって　毎日　すごく楽しそうだね
146.english: Your days must be really fun, Polar Bear,

147.japanese: カフェのマスターなのに
147.english: even though you're a café owner.

148.speaker: PANDA
148.japanese: 僕もここでバイトしようかな～

151.speaker: PANDA
151.japanese: 合格したら　どうしようかと思ったよ～
151.english: I was wondering what I'd do if I actually passed.

152.speaker: PENGUIN
152.japanese: キミは毎日　すごく脊髄反射で生きてる気がするよ
152.english: I get the feeling you go through every day purely on impulse.

153.speaker: SASAKO
153.japanese: こっちの道のほうは　何があるんですか？

154.speaker: POLAR BEAR
154.japanese: 行かないほうがいいよ
154.english: It's better that you don't go.

158.speaker: PANDA
158.japanese: ほんとに広いんだね　ここの庭
158.english: The yard here really is huge.

159.speaker: PENGUIN
159.japanese: あの　行かないほうがいいって　言ってた所は何があるんだろう？
159.english: I wonder what's in that area where we weren't supposed to go.

160.speaker: POLAR BEAR
160.japanese: ラマさん　お疲れ　好きなもの頼んで
160.english: Thanks for your hard work, Mr. Llama. Order whatever you'd like.

161.speaker: LLAMA
161.japanese: あっ　おかまいなく

162.speaker: POLAR BEAR
162.japanese: はい　できたよ　ピザ

164.speaker: PENGUIN
164.japanese: シロクマくん　よっぽど食べたかったんだね
164.english: Seems you really wanted that pizza, Polar Bear.

165.speaker: SASAKO
165.japanese: 帰り　早足でしたもんね
165.english: He was walking rather briskly on the way back.

166.speaker: GENTOO
166.japanese: それでは　月例営業会議を始めます
166.english: And now, let us begin our monthly business meeting.

167.speaker: GENTOO
167.japanese: まずは　ペンギンカードの　売上状況について
167.english: The first subject at hand is the sales of the penguin cards.

168.speaker: GENTOO
168.japanese: アデリーペンギンくんのアイデアで
168.english: The results of Adélie penguin's idea

169.japanese: 神経衰弱ゲームとして販売したところ！
169.english: of promoting the cards as a game of Memory

170.speaker: GENTOO
170.japanese: なんと！　この不況時に先月より１８０パーセント売上が増えました！
170.english: is an unbelievable 180% rise in sales just this past month, even in these hard times.

171.speaker: GENTOO
171.japanese: アデリーくん冴えてる！　この　カリスマ営業！
171.english: Well done, Adélie, with your charismatic sales approach.

173.speaker: ADELIE
173.japanese: ジェンツーくんの仕切りがよかったんだよ
173.english: It was all because of your leadership.

174.speaker: GENTOO
174.japanese: いやいや　そこはしめるところをギュッとしめるアゴヒモくんがさ
174.english: No, no. We can thank Chinstrap for bringing it all in when we needed to.

175.speaker: CHIN
175.english: It's because of all our hard work.

179.speaker: SASAKO
179.japanese: あの…　これって　２個セットで売ってるんですよね
179.english: Um, you sell two decks in a set, right?

180.speaker: GENTOO
180.japanese: そうだよ？　神経衰弱だからね
180.english: Yes, because they're used to play Memory.

181.speaker: SASAKO
181.japanese: じゃあ　逆に購入者数は減ってるんじゃ…
181.english: But doesn't that mean that fewer people purchased them?

182.speaker: GENTOO
182.japanese: キミ！　横からいきなり核心をついたこと言わないでくれるかな？
182.english: Could you not butt insuddenly like that?!

183.speaker: SASAKO
183.japanese: ごめんなさい　ごゆっくり

184.speaker: CHIN
184.japanese: やっぱり…　みんなペンギンに興味ないんだよ
184.english: I guess people don't care about penguins after all.

186.speaker: ADELIE
186.japanese: どこかにペンギン好きがこぞって集まるところないかなぁ
186.english: I wonder if there's a place where penguin lovers gather.

187.speaker: CHIN
187.japanese: ないよ　そんなもの

188.speaker: GENTOO
188.japanese: あっさり諦めないでよ

190.speaker: POLAR BEAR
190.japanese: お疲れ　バイト終わったんだ
190.english: Thanks for your hard work. Are you done with work for the day?

191.speaker: PANDA
191.japanese: ひどいよ　シロクマくん

192.speaker: PANDA
192.japanese: どうして動物園には　出前に来てくれないの？
192.english: Why won't you make deliveries to the zoo?

195.speaker: PANDA
195.japanese: そうだね　わかるよ

196.speaker: PENGUIN
196.japanese: キミたち　気持のいいくらいストレートな心の会話だね
196.english: You two somehow seem to have the most pleasantly straightforward conversations.

197.speaker: ADELIE
197.japanese: あぁ！　ひらめいちゃった！
197.english: Oh! I just got an idea!

199.speaker: ADELIE
199.japanese: 動物園だよ！　動物園にカードを置いてもらおう！
199.english: The zoo! Let's have the zoo sell our cards!

200.speaker: ADELIE
200.japanese: 動物好きな人が来るんだから　きっと喜んで買ってくれるよ
200.english: They get lots of animal lovers, so I'm sure they'll happily buy them. I wonder if they'd let us sell them there though.

201.speaker: ADELIE
201.japanese: だからさ！　カードを置いてもらう　かわりにだよ？
201.english: So we just have to pitch the idea that by selling the cards there, the zoo would get more visitors, too.

202.speaker: GENTOO
202.japanese: なるほど　入園者数が増えて　ペンギンカードが売れるようなアイデアね
202.english: I see. So they get more customers and we sell more cards.

203.speaker: CHIN
203.japanese: よし！　早速一度　家に持ち帰って検討しよう！
203.english: All right. Let's take this idea home and think on it.

205.speaker: GENTOO
205.japanese: あぁ～！　ちょっと待ってよ！

207.speaker: CHIN
207.japanese: えぇ？　検討しないの？
207.english: Huh? We're not going to think on it?

210.speaker: ADELIE
210.japanese: そもそもペンギンは　いろんな種類がいるから
210.english: We originally made these cards because there are

211.japanese: ペンギンカードを作ったんだよね
211.english: a lot of different kinds of penguins, right?

213.speaker: ADELIE
213.japanese: だからペンギンの個性がもっと伝わるようなアイデアがあればいいんじゃない？
213.english: So we just need an idea for how to appeal even more to the characteristics of penguins.

214.speaker: GENTOO
214.japanese: うんうん　いろんなペンギンが大活躍するようなこと！
214.english: I see, I see. Something so all sorts of penguins can get in on the action. Like some penguin action hero show?

216.speaker: ADELIE
216.japanese: いいじゃない　いいじゃない！
216.english: That's a great idea! I'll be the lead!

218.speaker: GENTOO
218.japanese: え！？　ずるいよ！　それじゃ僕も！
218.english: Hey, no fair! Then I'm gonna be...

220.speaker: ADELIE
220.japanese: キミ…　マンじゃないじゃん

221.speaker: CHIN
221.japanese: 僕は…　アゴヒモジャー

222.speaker: GENTOO
222.english: Sounds sort of like a villain. I think your face is a little dull to be a hero.

224.speaker: GENTOO
224.japanese: 顔の地味さは置いといて
224.english: Putting that aside, since we're talking action heroes, how about we all be heroes?

226.speaker: ADEliE
226.japanese: 僕たちが正義の味方で…
226.english: We'll be the heroes! And be super popular with the kids.

227.speaker: CHIN
227.japanese: ペンギンカードも大ヒット
227.english: And the penguin cards will be a smash hit.

228.speaker: ALL
228.japanese: なんかすごくいける気がしてきた！
228.english: This sounds like it might just work!

229.speaker: GENTOO
229.japanese: よし　プレゼン資料を作成しよう！
229.english: All right, let's ready our presentation.

231.speaker: SASAKO
231.japanese: なにか盛り上がってますね
231.english: They seem really excited about something.

233.speaker: PANDA
233.japanese: ペンギンさんは　特に盛り上がりもせずに
233.english: So, Mr. Penguin, you're just going to keep living

234.speaker: PANDA
234.japanese: 退屈な日常を　これから先も生きていくんだね
234.english: your boring, mundane life, without getting excited about anything, right?

235.speaker: PENGUIN
235.japanese: ちょっと！　僕だって　ワー　キャー言うときくらいあるよ？
235.english: Hey! I get excited sometimes, too!

236.speaker: PENGUIN
236.japanese: おいしいお刺身食べたりさ！
236.english: Like when I eat delicious sashimi! Forget it. I'll just shut up now.

237.speaker: ADELIE
237.japanese: 本日はお時間いただきまして　ありがとうございます
237.english: Thank you very much for your time today. Here is my business card.

238.speaker: HANDA
238.japanese: ペンギンカード販売促進部会
238.english: Mr. Adélie penguin,  of the Genus Pygoscelis, sales associate of the Penguin Card Sales Promotion Team?

239.speaker: GENTOO
239.japanese: 同じく　総務担当のジェンツーペンギンです
239.english: And I would be the team director, Gentoo penguin.

240.speaker: CHIN
240.japanese: 経理担当のアゴヒモペンギンです
240.english: And I am Chinstrap penguin, in charge of accounting.

241.speaker: HANDA
241.japanese: 私は飼育員の半田です
241.english: My name is Handa. I'm a zookeeper here.

242.speaker: HANDA
242.japanese: どうぞお座りください

244.speaker: HANDA
244.japanese: あ…　立ってるように見えて座ってるんでしたね
244.english: Oh, right. You look like you're standingeven when you're sitting.

246.speaker: HANDA
246.japanese: 本日は　どういったご用件で
246.english: What can I do for you today?

247.speaker: GENTOO
247.japanese: はい　私どもこのようなペンギンカードの普及を行っておりまして
247.english: Right. We are trying to promote these penguin cards.

248.speaker: GENTOO
248.japanese: ペンギンの種類を　知ってもらうために作成したのですが
248.english: We created them so people could learn  the various kinds of penguins, but...

249.speaker: ADELIE
249.japanese: こちらをお宅様の動物園の売店に置いていただけないかと！
249.english: We were hoping that you might consider selling them in your shop.

251.speaker: HANDA
251.japanese: ペンギンカードですかぁ…

252.speaker: HANDA
252.japanese: そういう商品の持ち込みはよくあるんですが

253.speaker: HANDA
253.japanese: 何分　売り場の面積が限られているので　なかなか…
253.english: However, our space is limited so adding items...

256.speaker: GENTOO
256.english: Not only are we trying to sell these cards,

257.speaker: GENTOO
257.japanese: こちらの動物園の入園者数増加に貢献するアイデアを持ってまいりました
257.english: but we'd like to present to you an idea on how to increase your visitor numbers.

259.speaker: GENTOO
259.japanese: こちらで説明いたします
259.english: We'll let this speak for itself.

261.speaker: VOICE
261.japanese: マンネリに陥っていませんか？

262.speaker: VOICE
262.japanese: 動物園に革新的アトラクションを
262.english: Bring an innovative new attraction to your zoo. Penguin Action Hero Show!

264.speaker: HANDA
264.japanese: わっ…　なに　なに！？

265.speaker: VOICE
265.english: At the end of the 21st century...

266.speaker: VOICE
266.japanese: 地球温暖化で　南極大陸に異変が起きていた
266.english: A peculiar event was occurring at the South Pole due to global warming.

267.speaker: SPIKEY
267.japanese: これから　南極の島々は我らユーディプテス属が支配するのだ！
267.english: From now on the islands of the South Pole will be ruled by the Genus Eudyptes!

270.japanese: 小さい子が悪いやつらに！
270.english: The little one is going to be attacked by the bad guys!

280.speaker: GENTOO
280.japanese: とまぁ…　ここでバトルが始まります
280.english: And this would be where the battle starts. Where's the rest?

281.speaker: ADELIE
281.japanese: ペンギンジャーの活躍で悪者を撃退
281.english: The Penguingers fight to defeat the forces of evil

282.speaker: ADELIE
282.japanese: 南極大陸に再び平和が訪れます
282.english: until peace is restored to the South Pole.

283.speaker: ADELIE
283.english: How does that sound? That's great!

284.speaker: HANDA
284.japanese: 子供のとき　大好きでしたよ　戦隊モノ！
284.english: I always loved action hero shows as a kid!

286.speaker: BABY E
286.english: Thank you for all your hard work.

288.speaker: GENTOO
288.japanese: このショーと合わせてカードを販売するというのはいかがでしょう？
288.english: How about we sell these cards to go along with this show?

289.speaker: HANDA
289.japanese: いや～　いいですね　続きが見たいです
289.english: That's a great idea! I'd love to see the rest!

290.speaker: HANDA
290.japanese: 早速　企画会議に出してみましょう
290.english: I'll immediately bring it up at the project meeting.

292.speaker: SASAKO
292.japanese: へぇ　やることになったんですか　ペンギン戦隊ショー
292.english: Wow, so the zoo is doing a penguin action hero show now?

293.speaker: PANDA
293.japanese: うん　半田さん　張り切ってるよ
293.english: Yep. Mr. Handa's really excited. It seems really fun.

294.speaker: PANDA
294.japanese: 僕も　パンダカード作って

295.speaker: PANDA
295.japanese: みんなで　パンダ戦隊ショーやろうかな
295.english: and do a panda action hero show with the others.

297.speaker: PENGUIN
297.japanese: キミには　節操というものがないのかな
297.english: Do you have even a shred of integrity?

298.speaker: PANDA
298.japanese: え～…　でも　絶対人気出るよ
298.english: What? It'd be a big hit.

299.speaker: POLAR BEAR
299.japanese: 思いっきり　パクリだね
299.english: It'd be a total rip off.

300.speaker: POLAR BEAR
300.japanese: 『北極刑事　シロクマン』はどうかな
300.english: How about North Pole Cop: Polar Bearian?

302.speaker: POLAR bEAR
302.japanese: では　今の０．０５秒のプロセスをもう一度　見てみよう
302.english: And now, let's see that 0.05 second process one more time.

303.speaker: PENGUIN
303.japanese: それも　パクリだね

304.speaker: PENGUIN
304.japanese: ここは１つ趣向を変えてさ

305.speaker: PENGUIN
305.english: and I do some traditional comedic story telling?

308.speaker: PANDA
308.japanese: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん

310.speaker: PANDA
310.japanese: 大ヒット曲の印税が僕に入ってくるようなパイプ役になってくれない
310.english: Could you possibly be the link to me somehow getting royalties from hit songs?

311.speaker: PENGUIN
311.japanese: それは相当難しいかな
311.english: I think that'd be rather difficult.

312.speaker: PANDA
312.japanese: ペンギンさんってすぐ諦めてしまうんだね
312.english: You give up so easily, Mr. Penguin.

313.speaker: PENGUIN
313.english: I think it depends on the situation.

314.speaker: PANDA
314.japanese: じゃあ　ペンギンさんに三秒あげるから好きなことしていいよ
314.english: Then I'll give you three seconds to do whatever you'd like.

315.speaker: PENGUIN
315.japanese: 短いかな　シロクマくん　終わろう
315.english: That's rather short. Let's end this, Polar Bear. Next week's Polar Bear's Café

316.speaker: POLAR BEAR
316.japanese: アナログ放送で送りします

317.speaker: PENGUIN
317.japanese: デジタル放送で送りします
317.english: It will be broadcast in digital.
